intro: Boussingaultia tucumanensis, commonly known as the Tucumán cactus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cactaceae. It is native to Argentina and is characterized by its cylindrical stems and clusters of yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with its succulent structure. It has spines that provide protection against herbivores and help reduce water loss. The flowers bloom in the spring, adding a vibrant touch to its desert habitat.
